channel.title: cuda on Random codewalks
channel.description: Recent content in cuda on Random codewalks

item.title: Using YOLO models on nvidia jetson
item.description: YOLO is a highly optimized machine-learning model to recognize objects in videos and images. Running these on your jetson nano is a great test of your board and a bit of fun. To use these awesome models you need to install darknet, the program that runs interference on a video stream from your camera. What you need: Jetson Nano Developer Kit with Jetson Nano Developer Kit SD Card image installed An USB web-camera Since we have a CUDA gpu on the jetson we should modify the Makefile to enable CUDA and make sure that nvcc is on $PATH.
